metadata.title: CVE-2016-7401 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The cookie parsing code in Django before 1.8.15 and 1.9.x before 1.9.10,when used on a site with Google Analytics, allows remote attackers tobypass an intended CSRF protection mechanism by setting arbitrary cookies.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.2
python-django-common - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.2
python3-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.7-1ubuntu5.2').
